content.description: An aesthetic thin face, just tall enough to be exciting and now with a most excellent landing zone.
content.location: Start on the head-high crimps to the right of the big foot ledge of Giant Man and head up from there with some techy footwork and a nice ending move.

content.description: Climbs a perfect stemming corner.  Many variations possible, two very positive aretes and a juggy lip, so a great starter boulder.
content.location: Back-side of the boulder with Feelin' Sappy on it; just follow the path left of Feelin Sappy

content.description: Start on the head-high start jug of The Campus Problem and traverse left using crimpy side pulls and tiny feet, climb into the start of Against the Wall and top out there.
content.location: Located on the first boulder in the Carnival Boulders area on the left hand side.

content.description: Low angle scoop right of Dan Akroyd. Another on the circuit. Not bad.
content.location: Faces Feelin Sappy, the little right slab

content.description:
Superb movement with a variety of ways to get through the crux.  Start on good edges and feet from the ground and move up the sidepulls, slopers, and edges.  The height may get to you if you're used to short problems, but the landing is great and safe overall.

From mid-height either use your best layback skills to move through the sloping pinches at the top, or hike up your feet and do a large deadpoint/dyno to the rail.

Top out straight above with an easy mantle.
content.protection: At least two crash pads and a spotter.
content.location: Carnival Boulders. In the little room on the backside of the Giant Man boulder.

content.description: To the left of 'The Rib', this problem starts on a low jug, with thin feet, shoot out left to a gaston sloper, pressing up, a few balance moves, following a very thin seam, small crimps, finishing up on the top lip.
content.protection: Same landing as the rib, a few pads, and a spotter to protect from the balance moves and reachy finish.
content.location: Carnival Boulders, just to the left of 'The Rib'

content.description: A sit start problem on a face behind the Ferret boulder.  Involves a sit start using a low crimp on the arete.  Using both aretes, slap up towards the top of the pickle boulder.
content.location: Immediately behind the boulder that the Ferret, Fen Fin, and Grain Brain are located.

content.description: Another little slabby climb in Carnival that isn't too bad.
content.location: On the next boulder over from Dutty Rock, look for a slab that could use a little light brushing.

content.description: Climb the orange-colored left arete of The Pickle, using a couple crimps on the left-side face as you progress. Probably V1 if you start seated; V-easy if you start standing (but very pleasant and an aesthetic line).
content.location: Immediately behind the boulder where The Ferret, Fen Fin, and Grain Brain are located. When you top out those problems, you'll be staring right at the orange arete.

content.description: In the middle of the slightly overhanging face, starts with a weird square/diamond pinch, up to two good crimps, before moving to the good lip for a somewhat spicy mantle.  Surprisingly fun!
content.location: To the right of Heeler V2, left of Butt Surfing, in the center of the boulder.

content.description: Start on the left side of the first boulder you come to at Carnival and traverse right, then finish at the most natural point along the traverse.
content.location: First boulder at Carnival, look for a right moving traverse along the lip

content.description: Start on Grain Brain but climb the face to the right. Felt V4 to me, but the moss probably made it feel harder.
content.location: Grain Brain

content.description: Climb up some fun slopers and ledges to a sloping topout.  Not quite as good as the other two lines on this boulder and the landing requires an extra pad, but still worth a lap.
content.location: Main Carnival area.

content.description:
Awesomely slabby.

Start in the middle of the face on good holds and style your way through some small crimps and footholds before a somewhat off-balance move to a big edge.  Top out straight above.

It's probably best to do this when it's dry; I got a bit sketched out after grabbing the good edge and finding it to be completely soaked with water along with the slopers on the topout.  After much hesitation and one near slip I managed to top it out, but it was way more exciting than I had anticipated
content.protection: A couple of big pads and a spotter
content.location: On the slab, in the main area of the Carnivals.  Just to the right of the warmup boulder.

content.description: Start low on the (flexy) flake and move up through a couple of cool face holds to a right-facing rail. Pretty fun for a couple of warm-up laps.
content.location: Left side of the boulder containing Fen Fin and Brain Grain.

content.description: Start as for the Ferret, but dyno up and right from the blocky hold to the lip. The mantle is harder than it looks.
content.location: The Ferret

content.description:
Start as for Grain Brain, traversing across the fun slopers into the start holds of Fen Fin, then continue working left through a fun crimp sequence to finish on The Ferret.

Adds a bit of difficulty/enduro to The Ferret, but not much. Works really well as a warm-up since you get a lot of moves in.
content.protection: Pads. A spotter to move the pads as you traverse would be nice.
content.location: On the same boulder as Fen Fin, Grain Brain and The Ferret.

content.description: How many granite 3-star V0 boulder problems can you name that aren't slabs?  I can't think of too many, but this is definitely one of them.  Haul yourself up a few feet of bulbous jugs to a fun topout and put a smile on your face!
content.location: Middle line on the south-facing warmup boulder.

content.description: A not too bad little boulder that starts on a left facing jug. Move to lip, and mantle. Not bad.
content.location: On the boulder that Mine/Butt Surfing/Heeler faces, but on the little backside of it. Left of the striking Tornado arete, look for this slightly less striking boulder.

content.description: Some granite left leaning crack, and then some filth and vegetables for good measure. Worth doing if you are up here, and have a comfy pair of shoes, and are running around doing everything.
content.location: On the other side of the same bloc that holds the Dan Akroyd and Rick Moranis Slabs

content.description: A legitimate part of the Carnival circuit. Do this little slab on the left side of the boulder facing Feelin Sappy/Tornado arete.
content.protection: You could use a pad or maybe not.
content.location: Facing Feelin Sappy, climb the little left slab

content.description: Start at chest high jug on arete. Climb up good jugs with few foot holds. Muscle the top out.
content.location: To the right of Against the Wall (V1+) on the arete.

content.description: A happy little boulder on the right side of the first boulder in the Carnivals. Start on a flake, go up, finish on some texture.
content.location: Right side of the first boulder you come to in the Carnivals, start with low flake and finish straight up.

content.description: The high double arete. Great holds the whole way up, but may be a bit reachier up top for shorter people.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter.
content.location: Around the corner from The Rib (V4), on the prominent double arete directly in front of a tall tree.

content.description: Start one hand on a low left-hand crimp, one hand high on a left-facing edge, and a food low on the good mini-ledge. Move left and up to the flake.
content.location: Leftmost problem on the boulder just opposite the prominent overhang with Big Happy or Legs Go Snappy (V9). To the left of The Campus Problem (V0+) on the arete.
